column4: hrm. for some reason I'm unable to archive my home folder into a .tar.gz. but it appears to finish archiving, and then the file isn't there.
what is your command
oh, not familiar with that, doing cd / && sudo tar czpf homebackup.tar.gz /home
should do it
you might want to do czpvf, so that you can see the files scrolling across and don't get tempted to kill it
yeah, not only gthat I'd be more likely to see where it fails.
ls -lh
or you can do like deb does, tar it up and then create an ar archive
man ar
the gzip thing right
sudo sed 's|/us|/ca|g' -i /etc/apt/sources.list
great britain
yeah, it has to go across the freaking ocean
that error happens from time to time, I am not sure what the deal is exactly
so if I switch to the gb servers it will wokr?
do the command I gave you before
it will switch you to canada
thanks for the help you offered with canada thouhg :-/. I guess I'm just going to have to wait a week for the download to finish.
you can kill it and start over probably, especially if all it has done is started downloading stuff
Whats the command for the canada sservers?
sudo sed 's|/us|/ca|g' -i /etc/apt/sources.list
that command will still work after I've already switched to gb?
oh no, change /us to /gb
sudo apt-get install mozilla-mplayer && sudo apt-get remove totem-mozilla
